answers.answer: Thats a little harsh... I hope your dr didnt say that my hormonal a** would have wanted to slap the dr for that
Yeah she was like you need to cut back on the carbs-_- I'm already told I look small for 30 weeks but according to my weight I'm a fat a*s.

Yeah im chunky too but only gained 6 lbs my entire pregnancy 38+1 weeks. My dr I think had his head on straight as to not bug me about my weight. And as long as baby is ok I dont see thw problem with a little weight

My doctor try to say slick stuff like having a diet and exercise. And keep telling me I'm high risk of diabetes smh. Idk y a doctor or anyone would critisize a woman about her weight expecailly pregnant!!! Smh
Yeah she said everything with the baby is good, but for me to cut back on the carbs -_-

I'm the opposite - gained a ton of weight (waayyy more than I should have) and still look small for a woman who is 39+ weeks pregnant. No one ever says anything about my weight, but I see the looks they give me...

If your baby is fine, she shouldn't have said anything at all. Sounds to me like its a good thing that was your last appointment with her. I'm sorry you had to deal with that, though. As women we have enough to deal with when it comes to our weight when we aren't pregnant. Add in those hormones and the feelings about our self image that a lot of us do struggle with? You've got an emotional volcano ready to erupt at a moment's notice. You'd think people, especially OBs, would be more sensitive to that fact.

question: I had my last appointment today with this doctor because I'm moving and apparently I'm a fat a*s and need to cut back on eating... -_-
title: well then...
